messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba theme
messages.msgSnippet: looking for something else I found a picture of one of these, it is called a NARUKO. Naru(naku) is a bird s cry so this was translated as a bird alarm but in
messages.messageBody:
looking for something else I found a picture of one of these, it is
called a NARUKO. Naru(naku) is a bird's cry so this was translated as a
"bird alarm" but in plain old English it would simply be a Clapper!
-t

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba theme
messages.msgSnippet: The thing on the bottom that looks like a drain grate is the sukashi form of the upper board with attached wood pieces.  The wooden pieces are loosely attached
messages.messageBody:
The thing on the bottom that looks like a drain grate is the sukashi
form of the upper board with attached wood pieces. The wooden pieces
are loosely attached at the top. The whole board is attached to a rope,
which is strung up. Someone or something runs into the rope; the rope
and board jiggle and the clackers make noise. Seems to be very
inefficient, but you see them in the chambara movies a lot.

Bob

Richard Turner wrote:

>http://tinyurl.com/2ymtq
>
>Anyone care to have a go at this ?????
>
>Rich
>
>

--
Robert J. Gilmore, MS, DVM
<rgilmore82@...>
